instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: 820 00244, After enter in suspension mode don't wake up
threads.message:
Hi, 

This one came for me with a blown <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>.
i replace for a new one and i was needed to made 2 rails pin 94,83 and  pin 93. 

Now it work's perfectly unless when the machine enter in suspension mode. when i press 1 key to went to normal, only show black screen.. But i know that it work's but with black screen.. i need to restart the machine to went to normal. 

any ideas for this one.. I hate this boards 820 00244 and 820 00045 always have more than the main problem.

threads.title: 820 00244, After enter in suspension mode don't wake up
threads.message:
Do you mean suspended after closing the lid?
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal.

threads.title: 820 00244, After enter in suspension mode don't wake up
threads.message:
I always have 3.3V on <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>! while giving image and when it goes to suspension mode! The system can't wake up, i only have black screen with backlight! 

it's suppose to be always 3.3V on <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> ?

thanks

threads.title: 820 00244, After enter in suspension mode don't wake up
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> should only go to 0V when close the lid.
For time enter to suspension, should be high.
